title: üî• Generative UI: The Future of Frontend (And Why You Should Care) - DevConf.CZ 2025
description:
Speaker(s): Daniel Ostrovsky

This talk is all about Generative UI. AI-driven user interfaces that actually adapt to users in real time. No more static, one-size-fits-all UIs. We‚Äôre talking about apps that think, respond, and evolve based on what users need.

But here‚Äôs the catch: if you‚Äôre still building UIs like it‚Äôs 2020, you might be in trouble. We‚Äôll dig into why modular designs (like Micro-Frontends) are the key to making AI-ready web apps, what skills frontend devs need to pick up right now, and how to work with AI instead of getting left behind.
---

Full schedule, including slides and other resources: 
https://pretalx.devconf.info/devconf-cz-2025/schedule/

title: Micro Frontends Conference 2024 - Shelly Goldblit & Daniel Ostrovsky: Cross-Framework Testing in MFs
description:
Talk recording from the most important conference and event for the Micro Frontends community. Understand the latest trends in Micro Frontends architecture and development. See how and why distributed frontends are implemented in the real world. Get in depth knowledge around topics concerning Micro Frontends. Meet those who shape the present and the future of the Micro Frontends community.

Abstract:
Ever wondered how to maintain consistent UI testing across different frameworks in a micro frontend setup? Our talk will guide you through the process of creating UI End-To-End & component testing for an application built with both React and Angular frameworks. Discover how to design framework-agnostic tests that enhance development flexibility and efficiency. 

About the speakers:
Shelly is an enthusiastic software engineer, with passion for software development, innovation and cutting edge technologies. Passionate about TDD and clean code. Over 25+ year of experience: software engineering & architecture, development management, process improvement, training, change management, InnerSource community management & gamification.

Daniel is a web development (full cycle) expert and teams manager with over twenty years of experience in the industry. Meetup organizer - 'NG-Heroes'. Volunteer at Tech-Career, nonprofit organisation which target to attain and advance professional careers In Israel's High-Tech for Ethiopian Israeli young adults. He is passionate about his family, about his gorgeous wife and his adorable kids. In his free time, he is '**The Best Developer in The World**' *based on my wife's ranking*.

Proudly presented by Piral.Cloud - the ultimate production-grade Micro Frontends discovery service: https://www.piral.cloud/

Interested in learning more? Check out the conference workshops at https://conference.microfrontends.cloud/2024/workshops or general workshops at https://workshops.microfrontends.cloud/

#microfrontends #conference #cloud #community #scalable #webdev

title: Micro-Frontend Architecture and Module Federation | Daniel Ostrovsky | Angular Tiny Conf 2023
description:
The micro-frontend architecture is attracting more and more developers, and module federation is a great addition to this architectural pattern. And as with any new technology, new questions are raised. 

Let's take real-life examples and live coding to answer the following but not limited to: how we should divide apps and whether there are specific criteria to separate them. 

Is my project suitable for the Micro-Frontend at all? When should I use Micro-Frontend and when Module Federation? And some other questions.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About Angular Tiny Conf

Angular is the beloved framework to thousands of developers around the world and has lately been moving at a very fast pace.

The Angular Tiny Conference is a quarterly one-day online event aiming to share all of the amazing ways individuals and teams are using not only the latest and greatest features, but also to celebrate the hard-won victories as a testimony to the longevity and health of the platform.

Find out more at: https://angulartinyconf.com

Thank you to our sponsor Techlabs 28 (https://techlabs28.com) your premier provider for full stack Angular applications. Have the next big idea or need help with an existing project, please get in touch. 
At Techlabs 28 We simply take care of IT

title: Daniel Ostrovsky - Full Stack is dead, long live the Full Cycle! "VinnytsiaJS - Online Thursday #5"
description:
Join to Discord Chat: https://discord.gg/euzddDk

Full Stack is dead, long live the Full Cycle! - Daniel Ostrovsky

When ‚Äútime to market‚Äù is critical. When bug fixing on production can‚Äôt take longer than a couple of hours. And it doesn‚Äôt matter if we are talking about a large company or a small startup, a new reality more often requires developers/teams to be a ‚ÄúFull Cycle‚Äù, - design, development, test, deploy, operate, and support.

Let‚Äôs talk about the past, present and why ‚ÄòFull Cycle‚Äô is a future of Web Development.

I think it‚Äôs highly important to stay tuned not only with the latest development technologies and trends but also with latest development models.

Follow Us:
http://vinnytsiajs.org/
https://t.me/vinjs
https://www.facebook.com/VinnytsiaJS/
https://www.instagram.com/vinnytsiajs/
https://twitter.com/VinnytsiaJS

title: How to adopt UX/UI in Angular application according to user‚Äôs permissions.
description:
In many projects, there are authentication processes (more or less). Many ‚Äúbest practices‚Äù were written in all known technologies, and so on and so forth.

But what happens after the user makes the login? After all, he, by far, cannot do everything. How to define what he can see and what he cannot. What buttons he has the right to click on, and what to change, create and delete.

In this talk, I want to consider the approach to solving these problems in a web application.

title: Special Angular-IL Meetup with Michael Hladky | 19.8.20
description:
Save the date for a special meetup with Nir Kaufman, Daniel Ostrovsky aaaand..... Michael Hladky!!

Daniel Ostrovsky
Full-Stuck RunTime type validation
---------
How to ensure type validation of data coming from external sources? 

‚ÄúRuntime boundaries type validation‚Äù or ‚Äúfull stuck type-safe‚Äù, - all this talking about the ability to validate types of data coming from external sources. It can be any API or WebHook Call, third-part form validation, DB queries results or file content (such as JSON or CSV). Let‚Äôs see how can we define runtime types for the expected data, that can be validated while the application is running, to create a smooth developer experience with strong assurances of correctness at build-time.


Michael Hladky
Fully Zone-Less - High-Performance Angular applications in post IVY
---------
The async pipe is boring! 

Understand the guts of Angulars change detection and why zone.js is your biggest enemy.
Learn the trick on template bindings, component rendering, and where you pay the biggest price.

As the tip of the iceberg, you will learn how to identify and avoid blocking UIs by analyzing flame charts and leverage task scheduling.

In the end, you will be able to build applications with zone-less performance even in a zone-full environment. 


Nir Kaufman
15 minutes of Angular - Patterns & Techniques
---------
Let's learn something new! Each session I will dive into an Angular feature, technique, or API. I'll focus on understanding the problem, and how to come up with a practical solution - the Angular way :)
Tips and best-practices included.


At the end of the meetup we will raffle 2 Jetbrains Licenses and a free ticket to AngularUP!

title: FrontEnd + DevOps = ‚ù§Ô∏è (Free Online Workshop 1 of 3)
description:
Session #1 will cover the following topics:
- What is DevOps (some history)
- Why we (FrontEnd developers) should care
- Intro into the World of Containers
- Hello World - Docker
- Serve our static build from Docker

*** Prerequisite:
1) Machine with Docker installed:
- macOS https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-ma...
- Linux-based: https://runnable.com/docker/install-d...
- Windows: https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-wi...
2) Docker Hub account: https://hub.docker.com/signup
3) A good mood and willing to learn.

title: Web Development meets DevOps. Session #1 (HEB)
description:
The number of manuals/tutorials on how to start programming in Angular / React / VueJs rolls over.

After we have developed our great, highly innovative and extremely useful application, what's next? How to show it to the world without spending too much money? Instances, serverless or static websites? What tools are available for Continuous Integration/Delivery? And what about SEO? How does Google crawl a single page app? Does new evergreen-googlebot make our life easier?
Server-Side rendering VS Pre-Rendering? Or is there another option?

We will take some prebuilt app and deliver it to the world, by answering all the questions above.

*********************
Session #1 will cover the following topics:
*********************
- What is DevOps (some history)
- Why we (FrontEnd developers) should care
- Intro into the World of Containers
- Hello World - Docker
- Serve our static build from Docker

||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||||
*** Prerequisite:
1) Machine with Docker installed:
- macOS https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-mac/install/
- Linux-based: https://runnable.com/docker/install-docker-on-linux
- Windows: https://docs.docker.com/docker-for-windows/install/
2) Docker Hub account: https://hub.docker.com/signup
3) A good mood and willing to learn.

https://github.com/danduh/web-devops-workshop

title: TS-Conf - Fall in love with TypeScript decorators
description:
Here is a video of my talk from TS-Conf (Oct-2019).
Google Slides: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1b5rPEaumNUEmh361he_mYnbLrpZniAtRl0JapGtigjc/edit?usp=sharing


Decorators is one of the most underrated features in TS. At the same time is one of the most life-changing features. Once you get it your life will never be the same. We will start from basics definitions and go all the way to advanced real-life examples and use cases.

Decorators are incredibly cool. They allow you to describe meta data directly in the class declaration, grouping everything in one place and avoiding duplication. Terribly addictive. Once having tried, you will use it forever However the decorators in TypeScript are not as simple as we would like. Working with them requires some skills.
In this talk we will try to cover:
Prologue
Decorators in TC39 stage 2. meaning and when to expect.
Babel
Frameworks uses decorators (Angular, NestJS, MobiX‚Ä¶)
Intro
Descriptor and why it‚Äôs matter
Simple logger decorator (live-coding)
Method decorator
Run time
Validators (live-coding)
memoize (livecoding)
Method‚Äôs param decorator
Why it‚Äôs so cool
Real life examples (livecoding)
Class Decorators (livecoding)
Class Composition
Class mixing
Advances (optionally)
Reflection, metadata
Use cases and examples (livecoding)
A coding is worth a thousand words‚Ä¶.

title: Jump Into Metaprogramming with ES6 (Hebrew)
description:
On 26/3/19, Daniel Ostrovsky gave a lecture about Metaprogramming during a JavaScript Israel Meetup.

Abstract:
Metaprogramming is entire world of programming, in new ES6 we have set of great new features which provides low level hooks into code mechanics.
Let's touch a tip of the iceberg!
We will talk about the definition of "Metaprogramming": some best and some bad practices.
And of course, - coding
We will go over:
Object Property Descriptor
Decorators (functions / methods and class)



Event Page:http://meetu.ps/e/GvynV/spJJ8/d

Thanks to our Gold sponsors : MinuteMedia
And our Silver sponsors : Whitesource

Join the group:
http://www.meetup.com/JavaScript-Israel


Video By: http://www.artcore.media

title: Daniel Ostrovsky - Adopting UX/UI to user permissions
Metaprogramming Part 2 - Class Decorators (Hebrew)
description:
On 29/5/19, Daniel Ostrovsky gave a lecture about Class Decorators during a JavaScript Israel Meetup.

Abstract:
Decorators are part of proposal TC39 (stage 2), this means that sooner or later decorators will become a part of the JS.
However, there is no need to wait! We can use decorators in TypeScript or with babel.
Let's see how decorators can be used in metaprogramming and class composition, which gives you more flexibility by composing functionality to create new classes.


Event Page http://meetu.ps/e/GLQWn/spJJ8/d

And our Silver sponsors : Whitesource

http://www.meetup.com/JavaScript-Israel

title: Custom Angular Decorators
description:
Angular custom decorators - Daniel Ostrovsky

@Componet(), @Injectable(), @Input() and even @NgModule() - just a functions‚Ä¶
I want to show how to create your own very useful decorators, that will save your time and will make your code cleaner and more readable.

Here is the repository with custom decorators:
https://github.com/danduh/ngx-custom-decorators

Feel free to contribute/open tickets / add ideas!!!
Let's create a cool and powerful library of decorators for any JS/TS framework!
